intro: Arabis lerchenfeldiana, commonly known as the rock白菜 or rock mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lobed, silver-green leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
